result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J. Lorenz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas J. Lorenz

records.addlTxt:
2:07 PM Defendant Thomas J. Lorenz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney James Gregory McCann appeared by video for Thomas J. Lorenz.  Attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Count 4, Disorderly Conduct, No contest plea entered.  Convicted.  $100 fine plus costs, total $579 to be paid by 12-06-2022 or 11 days jail for failure to pay.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample. 
Counts 1, 2 and 3 are dismissed and read in.

2:04 PM Defendant Thomas J. Lorenz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney James Gregory McCann appeared by video for Thomas J. Lorenz.  Attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury Calendar.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on September 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

BAIL HEARING -
Defendant in custody on bench warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The matter is continued for a preliminary hearing on 09-09-22 at 2:00 p.m. Br. 2.  The $1,500.00 recognizance bond previously furnished, along with all conditions, is continued and the defendant is remanded into custody serving a sentence on another matter.
Bench warrant with service of officer thereon.
Minutes.

9:49 AM Defendant Thomas J. Lorenz not in court.  Attorney Jordan W. Feest appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney James Gregory McCann in court for Thomas J. Lorenz.  Defendant fails to appear for court today.  No reason for the miss today.  State requests warrant.  Court authorizes warrant in this matter.  Defense requests until noon for warrant to be issued.  Court approves request.   Any cash bail previously posted will be forfeited unless within 30 days good cause is given for missing the appearance.
DEFENDANT IS TO BE REMANDED TO THE JAIL. DEFENDANT IS TO BE DENIED BY PUBLIC DEFENDER FOR SPECIAL BAIL APPEARANCE. DEFENDANT MUST REPORT IMMEDIATELY TO THE JAIL FOR BOOKING.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 08-04-22 at 9:30 a.m.   
Minutes.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 2:09 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas J. Lorenz appeared by video.  Attorney Carl Knepel appearing with the defendant.  More time needed to appoint counsel in this matter.  Initial appearance is adjourned to 07-25-22 at 1:30 pm. Br. 1.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of disorderly conduct and felony bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 06-27-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release and defendant is to have no contact with J.N.T., DOC 08-27-1999, S.S., DOB: 11-09-1990 and the premises at 2001 Washington Street, Two Rivers, WI.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
